value.title: Add multiple missing columns if missing in Power Query
value.excerpt: In todays video I am going to show you how to add missing columns if they are missing in Power Query so your queries wont break.  Link to the resource: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/87affbc4-364f-470a-80ee-c35d32f1d331/is-there-a-way-to-add-a-column-only-if-it-doesnt-already-exist?forum=powerquery

value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you two ways to reorder power query columns without breaking your queries! value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #7: ALL, ALLEXCEPT
value.excerpt: The function ALL returns all the rows in a table, or all the values in a column, ignoring any filters that might have been applied.
